channel.title: Rate this template
channel.description:
i made it for a guy i met on a game who owns a guild, he wanted a site so i made him the template...
http://onlyonerule.pwnds.info/pirates
i know the opacity doesnt work perfect in FireFox, it looks better in internet explorer

item.title: Rate this template
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“OnlyOneRule, post:5, topic:125424”]i tryed installing IE6 but it automatically searches for a later version of IE and cancels the instalation

are you on about the logo on the hat?? when i try blending it it it doesnt look like the same thing anymore

and the grainyness is mostly fireworks probleme, i made it in photoshop, then cut it up and tweaked it in fireworks because i find it easyer to work with, ill see if i can do something with it…[br][size=1]Posted on: July 20, 2007, 08:18:36 AM[/size][hr]ok i think the text is fixed

does anyone know how to get the opacity going in Opera?[/quote]

Like I said, get a Standalone installation of IE 6.

Maybe try making the logo black and white also.

Opacity isn’t supported by common browsers yet.

As you can see,

en.wikipedia.org

Comparison of browser engines (CSS support)

This article compares Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) support for several browser engines. These indicate the level of support for the given item in each engine. By default, the most recent version of the engine is implied. However, a specific version number can be listed; when this indicates full support, it's the initial version of the engine fully supporting the item. The DOM properties corresponding to vendor-specific experimental CSS properties are prefixed with the vendor-prefix, without any...

Opacity is CSS3, while most browsers are stuck at CSS2. Especially IE6.

Read full topic

item.title: Rate this template
item.dc:creator: @OnlyOneRule OnlyOneRule
item.description:
@OnlyOneRule wrote:

i tryed installing IE6 but it automatically searches for a later version of IE and cancels the instalation

are you on about the logo on the hat?? when i try blending it it it doesnt look like the same thing anymore

and the grainyness is mostly fireworks probleme, i made it in photoshop, then cut it up and tweaked it in fireworks because i find it easyer to work with, ill see if i can do something with it…[br][size=1]Posted on: July 20, 2007, 08:18:36 AM[/size][hr]ok i think the text is fixed

does anyone know how to get the opacity going in Opera?

Read full topic

item.title: Rate this template
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“OnlyOneRule, post:3, topic:125424”]dude the whole point is that its a bit out of place… it makes it seem more piratey…

and it is the opacity that doesnt work as thats the css function… there is no css function that allows you to do something like
filter:transparency(bla)…

its called opacity… i havent checked it in IE6 as i do not have it, i was hopeing for feed back on that one…

i know i have to work on the banner text, when it goes transparent it blends in too much

thx anyway[/quote]

No, when I say it’s out of place, I mean it’s out of place, taking into account the theme and such. Everything else is pixelated, while this was clearly just slapped on with no attempt to blend it in to make it look as if it was originally a part of the hat.

I understand it’s called opacity, but what you are dealing with is transparency as opposed to opacity.

Get a standalone installer for IE6, and you can see for yourself.

The graininess of the banner text has little to do with the transparency. I’m looking at the original .jpg, and it looks grainy. Your first mistake was to use a jpg. Your second mistake was to save it low quality (did you use Paint?).

Try getting some padding on the content and menu boxes, it looks a bit bare.

Read full topic

item.title: Rate this template
item.dc:creator: @OnlyOneRule OnlyOneRule
item.description:
@OnlyOneRule wrote:

dude the whole point is that its a bit out of place… it makes it seem more piratey…

and it is the opacity that doesnt work as thats the css function… there is no css function that allows you to do something like
filter:transparency(bla)…

its called opacity… i havent checked it in IE6 as i do not have it, i was hopeing for feed back on that one…

i know i have to work on the banner text, when it goes transparent it blends in too much

thx anyway

Read full topic

item.title: Rate this template
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“OnlyOneRule, post:1, topic:125424”]i made it for a guy i met on a game who owns a guild, he wanted a site so i made him the template…

http://onlyonerule.pwnds.info/pirates

i know the opacity doesnt work perfect in FireFox, it looks better in internet explorer[/quote]

It’s not the opacity that doesn’t work, its the transparency. And tbh, I see no difference between FF2 and IE7, except for the border around the content box. It is really poor judgment to not support IE6, since most people use IE6. The background is one whole image, which is never a good idea. The random insignia on the pirate’s hat is out of place. The banner’s text is grainy.

Read full topic
